alert.note: Alert for Hunt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 4:19PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Hunt County through 445 PM CDT... At 418 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Merit, or 10 miles northwest of Greenville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Wolfe City, Celeste, Campbell, Merit, Greenville City Lakes, Neylandville, Kellogg, Kingston, Clinton, Fairlie, South Sulphur, Floyd and Center Point. This includes Interstate 30 between mile markers 93 and 104. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central Texas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central Texas.
